intro: Vaccinium duclouxii var. duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux huckleberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates and acidic soils. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and dark green, while its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and usually pink or white. The berries, which are edible, are small, dark blue, and have a tart flavor, often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
